title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Children’s skincare products could contain a hidden danger, study finds
items.description: Children's skin and hair products may contain harmful chemicals that could potentially put their health and development at risk.

items.title: Hegseth’s Personal Phone Use Created Vulnerabilities
items.description: The phone number used in the Signal chat could also be found in a variety of places, including on social media and a fantasy sports site.

items.title: Banks getting the upper hand on card fraud but social scams getting worse, Mastercard says
items.description: AI is changing the cybersecurity game both for crooks and those protecting consumers.

items.title: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu Offers Condolences 3 Days After Pope Francis Died
items.description: The delay in issuing a statement reflected apparent tensions between Israel and Francis, who criticized Israel’s conduct in the war in Gaza.

items.title: Inside the Target CEO meeting with Black leaders amid the company’s DEI rollback and the boycott that followed
items.description: “It did not come up to all that we're expecting or needing.”

items.title: The Trump Organization is now selling ‘Trump 2028’ hats
items.description: Sales once again raises question of Trump's intentions.

items.title: George Santos, Expelled From House, Now Faces Sentencing
items.description: Federal prosecutors want Mr. Santos, whose pattern of lies and fraud led to his expulsion from Congress, to be sentenced to 87 months in prison.

items.description: Their new shopping assistant is inspired by Google Flights.

items.title: Francis Wanted a Church of the Poor and Put It Into Practice
